text: In the United States, the Triple Crown of Thoroughbred Racing, commonly known as the Triple Crown, is a title awarded to a three-year-old Thoroughbred horse who wins the Kentucky Derby, Preakness Stakes, and Belmont Stakes. (Some other countries also have series of horse races called the Triple Crown), Secretariat holds the stakes record time for each of the three races. His time of 2:24 for miles in the 1973 Belmont Stakes also set a world record that still stands. Winners of the United States Triple Crown: * 1919 Sir Barton * 1930 Gallant Fox * 1935 Omaha * 1937 War Admiral * 1941 Whirlaway * 1943 Count Fleet * 1946 Assault * 1948 Citation * 1973 Secretariat * 1977 Seattle Slew * 1978 Affirmed * 2015 American Pharoah * 2018 Justify ==References== Category:Horse racing Category:Sports in the United States
